input_text:
Job Title: Welder

Location: Mukwonago, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Super Products is currently accepting applications to fill the position of Welder at its facility in Mukwonago, WI.

To apply, click here: https://recruiting.adp.com/srccar/public/RTI.home?c=1054041&d=SuperProductsCareerCenter&r=5001032664206

Join the Super Team!

Super Products LLC, an Alamo Group Company, is a growing manufacturing company with a new headquarters in Mukwonago, WI and nationwide rental store facilities. We have been designing and manufacturing high quality vacuum truck equipment since 1973 that include the most innovative features available in the market.

Safety is our top priority. We pride ourselves on creating a safe and healthy work environment where our employees can grow and prosper throughout their careers. We offer competitive wages ranging from 23/hr to $27/hr. We also offer a customizable benefits package beginning on the first day of employment. Take the next step in your career and join a winning team!

Position Summary

Under immediate supervision, you will assemble component parts into a completed product following blueprints, work orders, and other written and/or verbal specifications. You will also position parts of the unit being assembled following specifications while using knowledge gained by your experience.

Position Summary

Under minimal supervision, welds fabricated metal components on production floor. Welds are performed on parts or subassemblies where cosmetics may not be a factor. Set up gas, arc or MiG welding equipment. May position and fit basic metal components. Produces component parts to blueprint tolerances.

Essential Functions Of The Job

 Maintains welding equipment making adjustments to weld different parts or subassemblies Performs Maintains welding equipment making adjustments to weld different parts or subassemblies Performs various simple welding operations (i.e. pins, knuckles, joints) following blueprint weld symbols with limited supervision Moves parts and/or workpiece manually, by crane and secures workpiece in weld fixture or table using clamps and wrenches Maintains production quantities, efficiencies and quality on parts welded Performs quality control inspections and cleans welded components Prepares surfaces to be welded and works with blueprints to verify accuracy of pre-assembled metal components to be welded Performs simple measurements using devices or gauges to check work Positions or tightens braces, jacks, clamps, cable slings, or may bolt parts in position for welding or riveting


Knowledge, Skills And, Abilities (KSA's)

 Knowledge of basic procedures of MiG welding and cutting tools Knowledge and understanding of basic procedures of voltage and amperage for given requirements Must possess basic math skills Skilled in the operation of grinders and deburring equipment Able to perform standard measurements using a tape measure and other measurement devices Able to weld simple assemblies with little supervision Able to read blueprints with weld symbols and specifications Able to lift and position fabricated metal parts manually, using a crane Able to wear personal protective equipment Able to work overtime and/or including weekends as production schedules dictate Able to weld vertical and down


Education And Experience

 High School Diploma or GED required Minimum 1 year of previous welding experience


Working Conditions

 Able to perform work in a non-climate-controlled metal manufacturing production environment Must be able to communicate with supervisors and fellow employees Requires (Near, Far, Depth and Color) vision Must be able to read and comprehend blueprints Must be able to utilize, read and understand a tape measure Must be able to work in an environment with noise (with 25-decibel earplugs in) at 75-decibels Must be able to kneel for up to 1 hour Must be able to be on his/her feet, on concrete, for 90% of their shift and an assembler must be able to walk up to 75% of their shift Must be able to climb 13ft by way of 12-inch rung ladders Must be able to lift, push and or pull up to 40lbs and carry that weight 5ft Must be able to bend, stoop and crouch  Able to work with their arms elevated for periods up to 5 minutes at a time


Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Perform standard measurements using devices or gauges to check work.

Must be able to lift, push, or pull up to 40lbs and carry that weight 5ft. Must be able to bend, stoop, and crouch.
